alert.note: Alert for Caroline (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 5:09PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Caroline County through 545 PM EDT... At 509 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Massaponax, or 8 miles northwest of Bowling Green, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rappahannock Academy, Villboro, Woodford, Guinea and Corbin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
